description: Credit-linked subsidy scheme for setting up micro-enterprises in non-farm sectors.
eligibility: Individuals above 18 years, SHGs, Institutions. General category - 15% subsidy, Special categories (SC/ST/OBC/Women/PH/etc.) - 25-35% subsidy.
benefits: 15-35% subsidy. Max. project cost: ₹25 lakh (manufacturing), ₹10 lakh (service). Margin money: 5-10%.
how_to_apply: Online through KVIC portal or designated banks.

description: Technology upgradation for small enterprises to improve competitiveness.
eligibility: Existing MSMEs with Udyam Registration in 51 specified sectors.
benefits: 15% capital subsidy (max ₹15 lakh) on institutional finance for new technology/machinery.
how_to_apply: Through participating banks/NBFCs with project report.

description: Free online registration for MSMEs to access benefits.
eligibility: Micro: Investment < ₹1Cr & Turnover < ₹5Cr | Small: Investment < ₹10Cr & Turnover < ₹50Cr | Medium: Investment < ₹50Cr & Turnover < ₹250Cr.
benefits: Collateral-free loans, tax rebates, subsidy access, preference in govt tenders.
how_to_apply: Online via Udyam Registration Portal (Aadhaar + PAN required).

description: Funding for non-corporate small businesses.
eligibility: Small manufacturing/trading/service businesses (including vendors, shopkeepers).
benefits: Loans up to ₹10 lakh under 3 categories: Shishu (₹50k), Kishore (₹50k-5L), Tarun (₹5L-10L). Interest rate: 7-12%.
how_to_apply: Through participating banks/NBFCs/Microfinance institutions.

description: Promotes entrepreneurship among SC/ST and women.
eligibility: SC/ST/Women entrepreneurs setting up greenfield enterprises (manufacturing/services/trading).
benefits: Bank loan ₹10 lakh to ₹1Cr (covering 75% of project cost). Margin money: 25%.
how_to_apply: Through 1,200+ designated bank branches with DIC certificate.

description: Certification for quality manufacturing with minimal environmental impact.
eligibility: Manufacturing MSMEs with Udyam Registration.
benefits: 80% subsidy on certification fees + additional incentives for women-led units.
how_to_apply: Through Quality Council of India (QCI) portal.

scheme_name: ASPIRE (A Scheme for Promotion of Innovation and Rural Entrepreneurship)
description: Promotes agro-based rural startups.
eligibility: Entrepreneurs/Farmers/FPOs in rural areas.
benefits: Seed funding up to ₹25 lakh + incubation support.
how_to_apply: Through 100+ Livelihood Business Incubators (LBIs).

scheme_name: SFURTI (Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries)
description: Organizes artisans/clusters into cooperatives.
eligibility: Traditional artisans (khadi, village industries, handicrafts).
benefits: ₹2.5Cr funding per cluster (infrastructure, training, marketing).
how_to_apply: Through KVIC/State Govt. agencies.

description: Mandates Central PSUs to procure from MSMEs.
eligibility: Udyam-registered MSMEs.
benefits: 25% procurement target (of total purchases) from MSMEs + 3% from women-led MSMEs.
how_to_apply: Register on CPSEs' vendor portals + Udyam certificate.

description: Financial support for MSMEs participating in global trade fairs.
eligibility: Udyam-registered MSMEs with export potential.
benefits: 75-90% subsidy on airfare/stall charges for international exhibitions.
how_to_apply: Through MSME-DI offices with prior approval.

description: Develops agriculture clusters with common infrastructure for small farmers and agri-entrepreneurs.
eligibility: Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs), Cooperatives, Agri-entrepreneurs with minimum 5 acres land or group of 50 small farmers.
benefits: 50-75% subsidy (max ₹10Cr per cluster) for cold storage, processing units, packaging facilities.
how_to_apply: Through NABARD or State Agriculture Departments.

scheme_name: PMFME (Pradhan Mantri Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises)
description: Supports small food processing units with technology and marketing.
eligibility: Individual entrepreneurs/SHGs/FPOs in food processing (max investment ₹10 lakh).
benefits: 35% capital subsidy (max ₹10 lakh), branding/marketing support, training.
how_to_apply: Online via PMFME portal (MoFPI).

description: Promotes agri-entrepreneurship through training and subsidies.
eligibility: Farmers, rural youth, agri-graduates (18-45 years).
benefits: 50% subsidy on equipment (max ₹1 lakh), skill development programs.
how_to_apply: Through Krishi Vigyan Kendras (KVKs).

description: Financial support for agri-startups and FPOs.
eligibility: Registered FPOs/agri-entrepreneurs with viable business plans.
benefits: Interest subvention (3%), credit guarantee, equity funding up to ₹50 lakh.
how_to_apply: Through SFAC portal or NABARD.

scheme_name: NABARD Dairy Processing & Infrastructure Development Fund
description: Subsidies for dairy processing units.
eligibility: Dairy cooperatives/FPOs/individual entrepreneurs.
benefits: 50% subsidy (max ₹50 lakh) for milk chilling plants, packaging units.
how_to_apply: Through NABARD regional offices.

description: Supports horticulture-based MSMEs (fruits, vegetables, flowers).
eligibility: Farmers/entrepreneurs with minimum 1 acre land (0.5 acre for flowers).
benefits: 40-50% subsidy (max ₹50 lakh) for greenhouses, packhouses, nurseries.
how_to_apply: Online via NHB portal with project report.

scheme_name: MIDH (Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture)
description: Comprehensive support for horticulture value chains.
eligibility: Farmers/FPOs/SHGs for post-harvest management projects.
benefits: 35-50% subsidy for cold storage, ripening chambers, processing units.
how_to_apply: Through State Horticulture Missions.

scheme_name: PMKSY (Per Drop More Crop - Micro Irrigation)
description: Subsidy for drip/sprinkler irrigation systems.
eligibility: Individual farmers/FPOs with minimum 0.5 acre land.
benefits: 55-100% subsidy (based on category) for micro-irrigation equipment.
how_to_apply: Through State Agriculture Departments or NABARD.

description: NITI Aayog initiative to support women-led startups including home-food production.
eligibility: Women entrepreneurs at any business stage (idea to scaling)
benefits: 1. Interest subsidy: 2% reduction on business loans up to ₹1 crore 2. Incubation support: 3-month free access to co-working spaces 3. Government e-Marketplace (GeM) registration priority
how_to_apply: Register at wep.gov.in with Aadhaar and business proof

description: Support for traditional village industries like papad, pickle, and khadi products.
eligibility: Individuals/SHGs with basic training in food processing
benefits: 1. 90% subsidy on equipment (max ₹25,000) for SC/ST/women 2. 75% subsidy for others 3. Free 15-day skill training with ₹200/day stipend
how_to_apply: Apply at nearest KVIC office with ID and training certificates

scheme_name: PMFME (Pradhan Mantri Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises)
description: Supports unorganized food processing units with financial and technical support.
eligibility: Existing unregistered food units with <₹5Cr turnover
benefits: 1. 35% capital subsidy (max ₹10 lakh) 2. ₹50,000 for branding/packaging 3. Free FSSAI license assistance
how_to_apply: Online application via pmfme.mofpi.gov.in with business proof

scheme_name: MSE-CDP (Micro & Small Enterprises Cluster Development Programme)
description: Develops clusters of similar enterprises for collective efficiency.
eligibility: Groups of 20+ micro-enterprises in same sector
benefits: 1. 70% subsidy on common infrastructure (max ₹15 crore) 2. 90% subsidy for SC/ST clusters 3. ₹10 lakh marketing assistance per cluster
how_to_apply: Submit project proposal via State MSME Directorate

scheme_name: CGTMSE (Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises)
description: Provides collateral-free credit to micro and small enterprises.
eligibility: Manufacturing/service enterprises with <₹5Cr turnover
benefits: 1. 85% guarantee cover for loans up to ₹5 lakh 2. 75% for ₹5-50 lakh 3. 50% for ₹50 lakh-2 crore
how_to_apply: Apply through 150+ partner banks/NBFCs

description: Market access support for SC/ST entrepreneurs.
eligibility: Udyam-registered SC/ST-owned enterprises
benefits: 1. 100% reimbursement on GeM registration fees 2. ₹5 lakh subsidy for product testing 3. 50% subsidy on patent filing (max ₹1 lakh)
how_to_apply: Register at scsthub.in with caste certificate

scheme_name: MSE-CDP (Micro & Small Enterprises Cluster Development Programme)
description: Supports development of enterprise clusters for collective efficiency.
eligibility: Groups of 20+ micro/small enterprises in same sector (e.g., 25 pickle makers forming a cluster)
benefits: 1. 70% subsidy on common infrastructure (max ₹15 crore) 2. 90% subsidy for SC/ST clusters 3. ₹10 lakh marketing assistance per cluster
how_to_apply: Submit project proposal via State MSME Directorate with: a) Cluster membership list b) Land documents c) Detailed project report

scheme_name: CGTMSE (Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises)
description: Collateral-free credit guarantee for MSME loans.
eligibility: Manufacturing/service enterprises with <₹5Cr turnover and valid Udyam Registration
benefits: 1. 85% guarantee for loans ≤₹5 lakh 2. 75% for ₹5L-50L 3. 50% for ₹50L-2Cr 4. Annual fee: 0.75% of loan amount
how_to_apply: Apply through 150+ partner banks (SBI, HDFC, etc.) with: a) Udyam Certificate b) KYC c) Business plan

description: Market access support for SC/ST entrepreneurs.
eligibility: SC/ST-owned enterprises with Udyam Registration
benefits: 1. 100% GeM registration fee reimbursement 2. ₹5 lakh subsidy for product testing 3. 50% patent filing cost (max ₹1 lakh) 4. Free tender bidding training
how_to_apply: Register at scsthub.in with: a) Caste certificate b) Udyam Registration c) Bank details

scheme_name: PM Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi)
description: Working capital loans for urban street vendors.
eligibility: Vendors active before March 2020 with vending certificate from Urban Local Body
benefits: 1. ₹10,000 first tranche (0% interest if repaid in 1 year) 2. ₹20,000 second tranche 3. ₹50,000 third tranche 4. 7% interest subsidy
how_to_apply: Through municipal offices with: a) Vending ID b) Aadhaar c) Ration card

description: Loans for non-corporate small businesses.
eligibility: Micro-enterprises with <₹10 lakh loan requirement
benefits: 1. Shishu (≤₹50k): No collateral, 7-12% interest 2. Kishore (₹50k-5L): Minimal docs 3. Tarun (₹5L-10L): Project report needed
how_to_apply: At any bank/NBFC with: a) Aadhaar b) Business proof c) 2 passport photos

description: Bank loans for SC/ST/women entrepreneurs.
eligibility: First-time entrepreneurs from target groups starting manufacturing/services/trading
benefits: 1. ₹10L-1Cr loan (75% project cost) 2. 3% interest subsidy 3. Free DIC counseling 4. 7-day loan approval guarantee
how_to_apply: At 1,200+ designated bank branches with: a) Caste/Gender certificate b) Project report c) Quotation for machinery

scheme_name: PM Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PMFME)
description: Supports micro food processing units with credit-linked subsidies.
eligibility: Existing micro food processing units, FPOs, SHGs, and cooperatives with <₹5Cr turnover

benefits.financial: 1. 35% capital subsidy (max ₹10 lakh) 2. Additional ₹50,000 for branding/packaging
benefits.non_financial: 1. Free FSSAI license assistance 2. Technical training

how_to_apply: Online via pmfme.mofpi.gov.in with: a) Business proof b) Project report c) Bank details

description: Supports traditional village industries including agarbatti and papad making.
eligibility: Individuals/SHGs with basic training in village industries

benefits.financial: 1. 90% subsidy on toolkits (max ₹25,000) for SC/ST/women 2. 75% for others

how_to_apply: At KVIC offices with: a) Aadhaar b) Training certificate c) Ration card

scheme_name: DAY-NULM (Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Urban Livelihoods Mission)
description: Poverty reduction through self-employment in urban areas.
eligibility: Urban poor (BPL families), especially women/SC/ST

benefits.loans: 1. ₹2 lakh individual loans at 7% interest 2. ₹10 lakh group loans

how_to_apply: Through ULBs with: a) BPL card b) Aadhaar c) Business proposal

description: Promotes self-employment among rural poor through SHGs.
eligibility: Rural BPL families organized into SHGs

benefits.credit: 1. ₹3 lakh revolving fund per SHG 2. ₹10 lakh cluster loans

how_to_apply: Through Village Organizations with: a) SHG membership proof b) Bank account

description: Financing for rural non-farm enterprises.
eligibility: Rural entrepreneurs (18-50 years) with project cost <₹10 lakh

benefits.subsidy: 25% subsidy (max ₹1.25 lakh) for general, 35% (max ₹1.75 lakh) for SC/ST/women

how_to_apply: At RRBs with: a) Project report b) Land documents c) Caste certificate (if applicable)

scheme_name: Support to Training and Employment Programme for Women (STEP)
description: Skill development for women's employability.
eligibility: Women >16 years from BPL families

benefits.training: 3-12 month courses in 10+ sectors (food processing, handicrafts etc.)

how_to_apply: Through registered NGOs with: a) Aadhaar b) BPL certificate c) 10th pass marksheet

description: Skill training for rural youth.
eligibility: Rural youth (18-45 years) with 8th pass education

benefits.support: 1. Free residential training 2. ₹10,000 seed money post-training

how_to_apply: At DRDA offices with: a) Aadhaar b) Ration card c) 2 passport photos
